update.description:
This takes care of migrating the current default branch of `ign-transport` into `ign-cmake1`, and turns `ignition-transport-log` into a proper component.

Most of the "big" changes are actually just private headers being moved from `include/ignition/transport` into `src/`, which isn't directly related to componentization or `ign-cmake1`, but it does make our file structure somewhat cleaner.
update.title: Make ign-transport compatible with ign-cmake1

content.raw: I've dug into that test, but it seems we're correctly protecting all of the callbacks with a mutex, so I don't know what would be causing this flakiness. We might have to run it through a debugger while hoping that it gets triggered.
content.html: I've dug into that test, but it seems we're correctly protecting all of the callbacks with a mutex, so I don't know what would be causing this flakiness. We might have to run it through a debugger while hoping that it gets triggered.

content.raw: My first impression would be that a race condition is happening somehow. That exception is usually caused by calling `operator()` on an uninitialized `std::function`. I doubt it's related to this PR, but I'll investigate anyway.
content.html: My first impression would be that a race condition is happening somehow. That exception is usually caused by calling operator() on an uninitialized std::function. I doubt it's related to this PR, but I'll investigate anyway.

content.raw:
weird, there was a flaky failure of `INTEGRATION_recorder` on brew:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64&build=402)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/402/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/402/testReport/junit/(root)/INTEGRATION_recorder/test_ran/

~~~
75: [ RUN      ] recorder.BeginRecordingTopicsBeforeAdvertisement
75: Chirping [100] times on [2] topics:
75:  -- /foo
75:  -- /bar
75: [       OK ] recorder.BeginRecordingTopicsBeforeAdvertisement (3518 ms)
75: [ RUN      ] recorder.BeginRecordingTopicsAfterAdvertisement
75: libc++abi.dylib: terminating with uncaught exception of type std::__1::bad_function_call: std::exception
75: Chirping [1500] times on [2] topics:
75:  -- /foo
75:  -- /bar
75/82 Test #75: INTEGRATION_recorder .......................................***Exception: Child aborted  6.79 sec
~~~

but it passed on the next try: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/403/testReport/(root)/recorder/
content.html:
weird, there was a flaky failure of INTEGRATION_recorder on brew:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/402/testReport/junit/(root)/INTEGRATION_recorder/test_ran/

75: Chirping [100] times on [2] topics:
75:  -- /foo
75:  -- /bar
75: [       OK ] recorder.BeginRecordingTopicsBeforeAdvertisement (3518 ms)
75: [ RUN      ] recorder.BeginRecordingTopicsAfterAdvertisement
75: libc++abi.dylib: terminating with uncaught exception of type std::__1::bad_function_call: std::exception

75/82 Test #75: INTEGRATION_recorder .......................................***Exception: Child aborted  6.79 sec

but it passed on the next try: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/403/testReport/(root)/recorder/

content.raw:
I'm seeing a recurrence of the pkg-config bug fixed in [ign-cmake pr 56](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/56/fix-pkgconfig-type-logic-for-core-project/diff) for the ign-msgs1 dependency, since it is using ign-cmake0 (ie. ignition-msgs1 is excluded from the pkg-config requires section)

I think we may want to switch to ign-msgs2 here, but we should also try to fix this bug if possible

cc @mxgrey
content.html:
I'm seeing a recurrence of the pkg-config bug fixed in ign-cmake pr 56 for the ign-msgs1 dependency, since it is using ign-cmake0 (ie. ignition-msgs1 is excluded from the pkg-config requires section)

I think we may want to switch to ign-msgs2 here, but we should also try to fix this bug if possible

cc @mxgrey

content.html: should we find ign-msgs2?
